intro: Maquira sclerophylla, commonly known as the maquira tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bombacaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon Basin. The tree is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and produces large, showy yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds covered in a sticky, fibrous substance. The plant is adapted to humid, lowland environments and plays an important role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
